ray.rage.scene.generic

Class GenericCamera

  • java.lang.Object
    • ray.rage.scene.generic.AbstractGenericSceneObject
      • ray.rage.scene.generic.GenericCamera
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Disposable, Managed<SceneManager>, Nameable, Visible, Camera, SceneObject

    final class GenericCamera
extends AbstractGenericSceneObject
implements Camera
    A generic camera implementation.
    Author:
    Raymond L. Rivera

    • Constructor Detail

      • GenericCamera

        GenericCamera(SceneManager manager,
              java.lang.String camName,
              Camera.Frustum viewFrustum)
        Creates a new camera with the specified parent manager, name, and viewing-frustum.
        Parameters:
        manager - The parent manager.
        camName - The name that identifies the camera.
        viewFrustum - The viewing frustum.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - If any of the arguments is null.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the name is empty.

      • notifyViewport

        public void notifyViewport(Viewport vp)
        Description copied from interface: Camera
        Notifies this camera that a viewport is using it.

        WARNING: This method is meant to be used internally by the framework and not by game clients. Use directly only if you really know what you're doing.

        Specified by:
        notifyViewport in interface Camera
        Parameters:
        vp - The viewport using this camera.

      • setFd

        public void setFd(Vector3f v)
        Description copied from interface: Camera
        Sets the forward (N) vector for this camera.
        Specified by:
        setFd in interface Camera
        Parameters:
        v - A Vector3f specifying the desired forward camera axis. Note that the three vectors U, V, N must be orthogonal.

      • setRt

      • setMode

        public void setMode(char m)
        Description copied from interface: Camera
        Sets the current operating mode of this camera.
        Specified by:
        setMode in interface Camera
        Parameters:
        m - A char specifying the desired camera mode. "c" means that the view matrix will be generated from camera axes U,V,N. "r" means that the view matrix will be generated from the node orientation. Mode "r" is generally used when attaching the camera to a game object.

      • getMode

        public char getMode()
        Description copied from interface: Camera
        Gets the current operating mode for this camera. Returns a char specifying the current camera mode. "c" means that the view matrix will be generated from camera axes U,V,N. "r" means that the view matrix will be generated from the node orientation. Mode "r" is generally used when attaching the camera to a game object.
        Specified by:
        getMode in interface Camera
